topic: How to design stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to design stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Designing Stream Processing using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to implement stream processing using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs, and Python 3.12+. It covers creating data streams, handling real-time events, and integrating it with FastAPI.
key_points: Understanding FastAPI for building efficient APIs
Creating data streams using libraries like uvloop and aiofiles
Handling real-time events using asyncio and websockets
Integrating stream processing with FastAPI for web-based API endpoints

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI
app = FastAPI()
# ... other FastAPI related code
# Stream processing implementation goes here

async def process_stream(websocket: WebSocket):
    # Implement stream processing logic using asyncio and websockets here

version_notes: This guide is applicable to Python 3.12+ due to the use of new features such as improved async I/O performance.
Ensure you have updated your development environment to Python 3.12 or later.
caveats: Stream processing requires careful consideration of resource management and concurrency control, especially when handling multiple streams simultaneously.
While FastAPI supports async functions out-of-the-box, you may need additional libraries to handle websockets and stream processing effectively.
